messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Ads
messages.msgSnippet: Apple Cider vinegar is useful for weight loss, varicose veins & much more. I sometimes use white vinegar for softening, but I don t like the containers!! Stats
messages.messageBody:
Apple Cider vinegar is useful for weight loss, varicose veins & much more. I
sometimes use white vinegar for softening, but I don't like the containers!!
Stats show that only approx. 17% of our 'recyclables' get recycled. So, I
use the sheets. Torn/cut into quarters. I use vinegar when I can hang things
outdoors.
Janis

Coyotes Corner
Very Cool Stuff for the World
<www.coyotescorner.com>

-----Original Message-----
From: Fetteroll [mailto:fetteroll@...]
Sent: Friday, March 28, 2003 4:43 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Ads

on 3/27/03 5:46 PM, starsuncloud@... at starsuncloud@... wrote:

> It's too diluted to make the smell stick I think.
> I've done it a few times and it really does soften the laundry nicely. No
> smell, but I only used 1/4 to 1/2 cup.

Vinegar gets rid of mildew smell too.

Joyce

on 3/27/03 5:46 PM, starsuncloud@... at starsuncloud@... wrote:

> It's too diluted to make the smell stick I think.

messages.subject: Ads
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/27/03 4:25:52 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/27/03 4:25:52 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Anyway, WHY doesn't everything come out smelling like vinegar when you do
the rinse *with* vinegar? Does anybody know? >>

It's too diluted to make the smell stick I think.
I've done it a few times and it really does soften the laundry nicely. No
smell, but I only used 1/4 to 1/2 cup.

Ren

me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
